title: I got a warning at the nursing home I work at for reminding a colleague that some parents don't deserve a relationship with their adult children.

author: Fuckyou62
text: Did you say it in front of the adult child? That's what matters here.

author: dorothybaez
text: I think she did. It's too bad that she got in trouble for it, but the adult child was likely very grateful.

author: Fuckyou62
text: Umm no. Saying it in front of the relative is incredibly inappropriate. Sounds like both employees were very much in the wrong and should stop pushing their views on someone else's family.

author: dorothybaez
text:
It was the first employee (the one who tried to shame the adult child) who was inappropriate. OP just told them to knock it off. In that adult child's shoes, I would be grateful that someone stuck up for me.

It's a bad situation all around.

author: Fuckyou62
text:
I agree that it's a bad situation all around.

My point was that if OP is wondering why they received a warning it's due to them giving their opinion on the relatives family. It's not their place. It's also not the place of the first employee to do the guilt trip.

If OP just said 'knock it off' then they shouldnt get a warning, however, it sounds like they the  proceeded to give their opinion on the family which was not appropriate.

author: dorothybaez
text: I guess we'll have to agree to disagree.
